trips.notes: Ski trip with Drew. Flights: AC 661 (YHZ→YUL 5:35 PM) connecting AC 301 (YUL→YVR 8:30 PM).

restaurants.name: Araxi Restaurant + Oyster Bar
restaurants.note: Fine dining icon — legendary wine list, local ingredients, seasonal tasting menus. Book well ahead.

restaurants.name: Wild Blue Restaurant + Bar
restaurants.note: Stunning space at the Audain Art Museum. Creative BC-focused menu with Japanese influences.

restaurants.name: Il Caminetto
restaurants.note: Vancouver Magazine award winner. Ricotta gnocchi with duck sugo is a must. Warm, upscale vibe.

restaurants.name: Red Door Bistro
restaurants.note: Cozy hidden gem above Village Square. Excellent cocktails, great pasta and steak frites.

restaurants.name: Bearfoot Bistro
restaurants.note: Famous for champagne sabering and vodka ice room. 5-course tasting menu. Bucket list experience.

restaurants.name: Bar Oso
restaurants.note: Small plates, charcuterie, and cocktails in Village Square. Same owners as Araxi. Great pre-dinner spot.

restaurants.name: 21 Steps Kitchen + Bar
restaurants.note: Hearty portions — bacon-wrapped filet, craft cocktails. Cozy lodge atmosphere in the Village.

restaurants.name: Christine's on Blackcomb
restaurants.note: On-mountain restaurant at Rendezvous Lodge summit. Ski there or gondola up. Stunning views.

restaurants.name: Mongolie Grill
restaurants.note: Build-your-own stir fry. Fun group spot in the Village. No reservations needed.

restaurants.name: The Wildflower Restaurant
restaurants.note: Inside the Fairmont Chateau Whistler. Elegant brunch and dinner with valley views.

activities.name: Garibaldi Lift Co (GLC)
activities.description: The classic après spot — right at Whistler base, massive patio, lively crowd. Gets packed by 3pm.

activities.name: Longhorn Saloon
activities.description: Legendary dive bar with live music and cheap drinks. The rowdiest après in the Village.

activities.name: Merlin's Bar & Grill
activities.description: Chill vibes at Blackcomb base. Good beer selection, casual crowd. Great after a Blackcomb day.

activities.name: Dusty's Bar & BBQ
activities.description: Creekside local favorite. Relaxed atmosphere, solid BBQ, pool tables. Less tourist-heavy.

activities.name: Scandinave Spa Whistler
activities.description: World-class Nordic spa — hot/cold plunge pools, eucalyptus steam, silent relaxation. Book ahead, often sells out.

activities.name: The Spa at Four Seasons Whistler
activities.description: Luxury full-service spa with mountain views. Hot stone massage, facials, couples treatments.

activities.name: Whistler Blackcomb Skiing
activities.description: 8,171 acres of skiable terrain, 200+ runs, 16 alpine bowls. North America's largest ski resort.

activities.name: Peak 2 Peak Gondola
activities.description: Record-breaking gondola between Whistler and Blackcomb peaks. 4.4 km span, 436m above the valley.

localTips: Book Araxi and Bearfoot Bistro ASAP — they fill up fast in late February
Cascade Lodge is walkable to everything in the Village — no car needed once you're there
Hit GLC by 2:30pm for après to get a patio spot before the rush
Scandinave Spa enforces a silence policy — perfect recovery after a big ski day
Download the Whistler Blackcomb app for real-time lift line wait times
Late February often has the best snow conditions — deep base with regular top-ups

weather.conditions: Late February typically brings fresh snow, with base depths over 200cm. Expect mix of sunny cold days and snow. Village temps hover around -1°C to -7°C; colder at summit.

items: Fly back to Halifax same day

trips.notes: Day trip to Toronto — same-day return.
tentree Planting Summit — SS27 hold dates. urbanbutter brand event.
